Model

Mathematical models are an integral part of our project. They allow us to gain an insight into the functioning of the constructs we designed as well as enable us to predict and verify its behaviour. Considering our non-existent access to a laboratory environment due to COVID-19, these models form the cornerstone of our project.

We have tried to integrate our models during each step of the modelling process with the experiments we have designed. The benefits that this approach has are two-fold: one, it allowed the experimental and theoretical portions of the project to complement each other, and two, it also allowed us to leverage the insights provided by the wetlab aspects.

Modelling these systems also allowed us to predict their behaviour and determine how they could be incorporated into our final design.

ModelBiosensor

ModelKill Switch

ModelInoculant

ModelGrowth Curve

ModelDocking

ModelAuxotroph
